Reviews.Title: “All in all, average hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Christoph E
Reviews.Content: We visited London with our class and spent five days and four nights in this hotel. The hotel offers a good accessibility due to its proximity to the Earl's Court station (only few minutes of walking). Also a 24h supermarket and some pubs are in the immediate vicinity. The rooms were quite acceptable, but the cleanliness could be much better and for me personally, the vermin traps were disturbing. The small kitchenette was a real benefit especially if you got hungry in the evening. But the selection of kitchen utensils available wasn't that big. For breakfast you had the choice of English breakfast, scrambled eggs, toast or cereals. I had no problems with the service. All of the employees were friendly and answered every question I asked. All in all, this is an average hotel for a fair price and I can rcommend it for School Trips.

Reviews.Title: “For the price performance ratio the hotel is ok!”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie N
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a class trip to London. The position of the hotel is good. The tube station Earls Court is just few meters away and so you could explore London very good. Pubs, shops, supermarkets and restaurants are also reachable in just a few minutes on foot. We had got a room for four people, with a double bed and two single beds. Besides in the room was a small kitchenette, an own bathroom und a TV. The room was small, but clean! On one day our room wasn’t clean and we didn’t get new towels. When we complained about it, on the reception, we got immediately new towels and the other days our room was always made. The breakfast was ok, you can choose either an English breakfast (egg, beans, sausages), toast or cereals. To the employees you could say that they were a little bit unfriendly. You had the feeling that, they were a little bit annoyed by our questions, but they helped! Because of maintenance works the complete heating system failed, in the whole hotel. Because of that it was very cold throughout the hotel and especially in the breakfast room. But every room had got a small heater for the defective heating. Finally I could say for the price performance ratio the hotel was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Wildernesscycling
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 2 consecutive weeks. The first time I left some valuables in the chest of drawers. When I remembered I called them and they were very helpful. They immediately went to the room, put the items in a bag to be left at reception and called me back. I picked them up the following week. I reckon I wouldn't have got such a responsive service as that from a 5 star hotel! Both rooms I stayed in had a kitchenette; the 2nd had a microwave which was handy. Also it is close to West Brompton tube and of course Earl's Court exhibition centre.

Reviews.Title: “Proper dump”
Reviews.Author: Malta_12
Reviews.Content: The location is nice but the hotel is shabby and dingy. The staff are unfriendly abrubt and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Boka”
Reviews.Author: Shepard_12
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good! Earl's Court is a very nice area and the hotel is a only a few minutes walk to the closest tube station and you are in the center within a couple of minutes. The hotel itself is alright, you get what you pay for. The heating in the room didnÂ´t work, but we had an electric heater instead (I like it could, so I didnÂ´t use it). The room was quite small and old. The staff is quite helpful and the breakfast is really just toast, jam and cereal but they do serve a typical English breakfast as well. All important things such as a supermarket, banks and restaurants are near the hotel. If you are on a budget and want a good location, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: Julia K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and you just need to walk a few metres to the underground or to the station. IIf you are hungry that is no problem too, because you only need a few minutes to nearby pubs or restaurants. We had a clean room for four persons and beds were made almost daily. For breakfast you can choose eather an English breakfast or just toast or cereals. The staff was okay and answered every question. For example one day our room was not cleaned so we talked to them and on the next day everything was fine. It was cold in the rooms and the breakfast room, but the rooms had little heater so that you could get it there warm at least. Finally i think the hotel is good at the price performance ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay!”
Reviews.Author: miss_imperfect
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel via their website, which Traveltura is managing (i think?), firstly i must say, that the staff Ryan from Traveltura, was awesome and of most help! his replies were efficient and polite and i must compliment him! i have to admit that before we arrived in London we were a little worried at how our room would be like. when we checked in at the hotel, we were greeted by a korean lady, who allocated us with a room on the first floor. the room was quite old, the kitchenette at the front of the room upon entering, there was a large mirror there and a table, and then the toilet. to get to the beds we have to climb up a flight of steps, and there was a large mattress, with an extra single mattress as well. the window opened to the backyard where they were some remnants of construction work. while my boyfriend was alright with the room (he felt it was an interesting layout), i was a little concerned with sleeping with the windows open as we were both afraid of heat and stuffiness and i for one preferred to wake up being able to sit upright in bed but for this room i could stretch my hand outright while lying in bed and i would already touch the ceiling. BUT, we went down and voiced our concerns to the lady, and she did a quick check and handed us keys to a room on the 3rd floor for us to have a look! we did a quick check and took the room on the 3rd floor without hesitation. our room was at the end of the corridor on the 3rd floor, and there was a lift in the hotel so it was prefectly fine. this room also had a small area kitchenette, which had a microwave, hot water flask and kitchen untensils. there was also free coffee and tea satchets which we appreciated. there was a double bed against the wall, and a lovely heater which we dearly missed when we were out of the hotel in the cold, haha! the windows opened fine and overlooked eardley crescent which the hotel was on. there was a little cupboard, mini table and 2 chairs. the room was small but cosy and i loved it. the water pressure in the shower was a little weak and took awhile for the heater to heat up, but wasn't a problem for us. there was a good supply of shampoo and soap and we had no complaints. no heater in the toilet though so it was a little chilly. we both had huge backpacks but managed to pack/unpack our stuff without a problem, and we tried to put our stuff on the chairs and table so the cleaning lady wouldn't have a hard time. we actually had a pretty good stay and for the price we paid, we aren't complaining! everything is expensive in london and quite frankly i think some people do nitpick when it comes to rating hotels. coupled with service from Ryan (Traveltura), we definitely enjoyed our stay at Boka Hotel, and would like to thank the staff for their help. The guy at reception always smiled and greeted us, and helped give us directions when we asked. breakfast was always a delightful mix of bacon, beans, eggs and toast, there was also cereal and the usual juice and coffee/tea. there was free wifi in the hotel which worked best downstairs in the dining room! overall we had a good stay here and i liked our room 307 (i think), studio-ish feel to it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFlores99
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was cheap and looked decent in the pictures, but I regret booking this hotel. First, I asked for a double room with a queen bed for my husband and I. When we checked in the receptionist never told me that the room she had given me had twin beds. I had to get on the elevator, go thorough a dark corridor, thru a door, down a flight of stair and there was my room #203. The room had a skeleton key and you could see the whole room through the key hole. Once we entered the room, the sink had tape on it because I assume it leaked and so did the faucet. The bathroom was clean but once we entered the mini room where the beds were it had a horrible stench. You could not sleep from the smell. I went down to reception to ask the person at the desk that I need a queen bed not 2 twins. She told me that at the time she could not switch the room because she had a booked hotel and I would have to sleep there the night and then maybe they could switch our room. My husband was not happy with the response nor the room and we checked out that same day! We did not sleep there, and we got ourselves another hotel. It was not a hotel more like a hostel! The room we got was very depressing as well. I hope the review helps and really don't book this hotel you can get something way better for the same price or maybe a little more but I rather pay more than stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Yavor A
Reviews.Content: Just want to share my delight with you. I am extremely happy with my stay in Boka Hotel! It's my second time and for sure not the last. The staff is fantastic! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “This should be named a hostel”
Reviews.Author: antonino6
Reviews.Content: the wroste place i ever stayed The People that worked there where rude unfriendly exp for french guy at front the room was dirty , the bed was not a bed but 2 matres stuck together small rooms the most unfriendly and dirty place i have ever seen

Reviews.Title: “London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Astrojim
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel in the Earl's Court area of London. Easy access to the tube and Museum area. Very good value for money and I intend to use this hotel on future visits. Very friendly staff. The furniture is old, but the room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ferdifred
Reviews.Content: If you expect to walk into an AMAZING hotel, you should simply have spent more money! I think for the location, the cleanness and the service Boka is a great place to stay. Of course everything is old, but it's clean! The service was fast and not unfriendly, they fixed a room-mess-up within minutes. I would stay here again - simply because it's one of the best LOW BUDGET places around. They even had FREE WIFI, something that was not on their website. And very good TV channels too. I think it's a winner. But remember - you're not going to be impressed with how it looks!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with the hotel and would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: Joolymc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with out 21 month daughter. All of the staff were very very friendly and lovely to our daughter. It was great having a kitchenette so we could keep snacks for her in it. We had a quite room with no noise or interruptions. The rooms are small but for the price and location I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded rooms are nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: snowpingu
Reviews.Content: This is my second review as things have changed a bit since my last visit. This time I was in a refurbished room and it was very nice. As ever, the furniture is eclectic and curtains thin but the rooms clean, towels and toiletries provided, and the bed comfortable. The shower pressure was good and only the occasional glitch in temperature - probably is someone else turned theirs on. Having a small kitchenette was nice, although I didn't have chance to use it, and a door between this and the bedroom was a nice touch. I recognised some of the staff from previous visits, so it's good to know there is continuity (and an improvement in English!). They were generally friendly. Breakfast is still the same - nothing special but enough to get you going in the morning. Location is great for Earl's Court and the tube. The only downside is the lovely hard floors mean noise from the room above was at times terrible - why did they want to move furniture and clog-dance at 5am?!

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty, noisy hotel but the bed was real comfortable”
Reviews.Author: carmen_hk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and a man (probably a dissatisfied guest) was yelling at the reception that there was a rat in his room and he recorded it on his camera. We ignored it and just checked in. The room furnishing was old and dirty and some furnishment was broken like the old closet and the bedside table and there was a crack in the window. The sanitary was old and calcified with dirty yellow/brown edges. The next morning we woke up because of a worse leakage at the front door of the room. There were cracks in the sealing. When you flush the toilet it reach the edge and then it flows slowly away. The only positive point is the comfortable bed and clean linen.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal we got in London”
Reviews.Author: JennT373
Reviews.Content: Our personal experience with the Boka Hotel was nothing but great! We stayed for a total of three nights, but staff at the hotel allowed us to store our luggage there an extra night while we queued at Wimbledon. If you are looking for decent accommodations at a great price (esp. for London) in a central location, then look no further. The hotel is located directly between the Earl's Court station (Zone 1) and the West Brompton station (Zone 2), so you can plan accordingly for where you plan to go. The hotel always has breakfast downstairs (which is decently good) each morning. There is always someone at the front desk for assistance and our room was better than what I expected (after reading the reviews on here). The only negative thing I'll say about the room is that the shower had no shower curtain or door, so water always seemed to go everywhere (it's hard to rinse out long hair without doing so). Other than that, we had a pleasant stay, and I would recommend the Boka Hotel to any traveler that's not looking for luxury, but just good enough accommodations to stay in after a full day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: niecey-b
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean apart from badly stained toilet (room 111) the water was always cold curtains Hung down like a doss house. There was a bad smell in foyer. Breakfast cold its a shame as it was a lot of little things that could have been avoided I just don't know if it would be worth going again

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money- no frills but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: pio1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certianly not the ritz but for the money you pay it is ideal. The room we had had two bedrooms and small kitchen. Breakfast is great- cant understand why people complain about it- theres a choice of cereal followed up by a nice full english- lots of tea, coffee and OJ! The room is basic but safe and clean- bathroom ok- all workable, Few bits of bad decoration but who cares if you are just sleeping there. The staff were freindly. All in all excellent value for money and good location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RickSpenser
Reviews.Content: As clean as it could be, wonderful daily service of rooms. Superb location in central London. Spencer takes good care of you, as do the lovely staff. Nice breakfast. Great value for money. Small rooms, but that's London, and they clean them well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this year”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveltampa
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed here and were quite happy, but not this year. I don't require much from a hotel, just a comfortable bed and the ability to take a warm shower. In these 2 aspects the Boka failed. In contrast to last year the bed that I had this time was very uncomfortable. I could feel the springs poking into my skin. ( I had to sleep with my coat, 2 towels and the comforter under me to minimize the discomfort of the springs. I probably should have asked for a different room but it was the weekend of the Royal wedding so I was sure they were filled to capacity plus we had already fully unpacked and were very tired from the transatlantic flight and hadn't slept for close to 48 hours. On the first day we were able to take warm showers. It was the middle of the day so there was warm water available. Although there was no water pressure and water came out of only about half of the shower head, but I can deal with that. I just couldn't wash my hair for three days because there was not enough water to rinse it well. The following morning I wasn't so lucky. We woke around 7:30a.m. and by that time all of the hot water must have been used up. So if you want to take a shower do so in the afternoon. Other than those two things everthing else was fine. The room was at the back of the building and had a nice bay window with a view of the garden. The Bokas garden has been cleaned up a bit & I'm sure when the room renovations are done it will be fine. I could see the neighbors garden and it was beautful. The location is great, only a short 5 minute walk to the underground and I really love the neighborhood. We only had a frige not a microwave , but that was fine. I appreciated having a frige to put drinks in. The breakfast was good, your typical English breakfast. And everyone that worked there was very friendly. I feel a bit bad writing a bad review and am not sure if I will give them one more try. As I said the matress was REALLY uncomfortable. Please manager of Boka Hotel, if you are reading this. Please get a new mattress for room 314, or at the very least get a foam cover. I'm sure the water pressure and shortage of hot water is something you don't have control of but you can fix the bedding situation. I will be back to London next year and will have to think long & hard about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and excellent location great value !”
Reviews.Author: gwentherbert
Reviews.Content: On arrival bit apprehenisve but they are altering recetion area. Room and bedding spotless and even had small kitchenette. Bedroom furniture and in breakfast room "unusual" but for price was not expecting too much. Staff very helpful and full breakfast excellent -fresh coffee and toast in abundance. Would definetly stay again as location details were spot on and price compared to other near by hotels excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: natm81
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for me, my sister and young daughter. This was just a 1 night stay and perfect for us. We had only booked a double room so we were very suprised to find they had given us a triple room when we arrived. The room also had a small kitchette area that we were not expecting. The room was clean and well presented. Only down side was that it was a very warm weekend, the heating was on so we had to have the windows open which obviously let the street noise in. The breakfast was quite basic, a choice full english or cereal, but the quality was beautiful. The staff were also very polite, friendly and helpful. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for somewhere to crash for a a night”
Reviews.Author: Jupeter99
Reviews.Content: We chose the Boka because we were going to gig at Earl's Court and needed somewhere to sleep as it finished after the last train home to Bristol. It's basic but what do you expect for those kind of prices in central London near the tube station/bars/restaurants/ venues? If you just need somewhere to crash then it's well located and well priced. I certainly wouldn't chose it for a holiday location or more than one or two nights but it served our purpose pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Best to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: jrr270455
Reviews.Content: This ended up being booked through Traveltura and I would not take their recommendations again. A cheap backpacker hotel that makes no effort to be anything other than take your money and good luck. Original room was uninhabitable and should have been out of service. They did move us after complaining but should not Hsve been necessary. Breakfast was depressing that we could not take for 2 nd and 3rd days. One helpful staff who was the regiular but others dud not care. Even if on budget as we were look at all alternatives first.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Zimmermaen
Reviews.Content: The boka hotel is an old and little hotel near the underground. The room was very dirty. We had hairs on the toilet seat, in the bed and the washbarin was mouldy. We asked the staff for cleaning up our room but they were totally unfriendly and didn't clean it up. The breakfast wasn't good. I ate each day in the city. The room was big enough for four persons but it was too expansive for this hotel and the unfriendly staff. Please don't stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What can we say?”
Reviews.Author: Honi_Miri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 7.02 till 10.02. and we think that the boka hotel is a nice, small hotel near the tube. The rooms were small but for 3 peoples we had enough space, we mean as a tourist, a large room is the last thing that we needed. The room was for sleeping, there were clean, and the breakfast was ok. Reception staffs were friendly, efficient and obliging. Bad points were that we have no shower curtain or panel on both so floor gets wet when you shower and it's not very pleasant and that the high-level bed has wobbled. For this price the hotel was ok. We were really happy and we recommend this hotel. (miri&Honi)

Reviews.Title: “comment”
Reviews.Author: nadjalanzerath81
Reviews.Content: In my view the Boka Hotel wasnÂ´t that bad. It is a cheap hotel and because of that you can not expect so much. However it would be better if the rooms get cleaned more thorough. The toilet seat was dirty and we had no light in the bedroom, but after informing the staff they cleaned the toilet and repaired the light (but they only brought one of six light bulbs). The british breakfast and the service was really bad. It wasnÂ´t organized very good because you had to wait too long for the dishes. The hotel is located very central. The tube station is near the hotel(about two minutes to walk) and there is a supermarket. Bella & Nadja

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Simon123-8
Reviews.Content: The Boka Hotel was generally in a good state. It isn't at all a luxus hotel, but for the price it is more than ok for London. It has a central location, near the Earls Court tube station. You need just 2 minutes. The rooms had the basic equipment. The bedrooms had a brilliant roomsubdivision in the ceiling, which was built to a bunk bed. xD At the beginning the english-breakfast tasted a bit strange, but at the end of the trip I've got use to it. The Boka Hotel is generally a good hotel if you want to visit London. Simon M.

Reviews.Title: “Opinion about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraDeutschland
Reviews.Content: Our room was ok.The bathroom and living room were clean. But I find the bed for two persons to small. A window did not close completely. The location was good and there is a good transport connection. The toast was ok, but the english breakfast was not my. Indeed, I found the hotel to expensive. Sandra K.

Reviews.Title: “Class Trip Feb 2011”
Reviews.Author: Steffi3188
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, close to EarlÂ´s Court with good & easy compounds to all sights. BUT unfortunateley the hotel especially the cleanliness wasnÂ´t acceptable. There were undefined hairs everywhere and the bed was blurry. Staff was friendly, except of one person, who was very unfriendly. Breakfast was ok for those who like the typical english one, but the room where it was served smelt bad. Well, I guess there are better places to stay in London, anyway, the trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best placed wanna be hotel”
Reviews.Author: xBmwx
Reviews.Content: The Boka Hotel is a very small hotel near Earl's court. If you go in , you can see ,that it was an multiple families house wich was switched into a hotel. The rooms aren't really big ,but you have a useful kitchen , a bathroom and a bedroom in every suite. The toilletes arent clean , sometimes you seemud on the floor. But the beds are comfortable. The location is really good , every one knows earls court and at the opposite site of the earls court underground station there is abig shopping street where is an exchange too. If you get lost you have only to ask for earls court and everyone can describe you the way back to the hotel. But the hotel itself isnt good known bei the londoners . We had ordered breakfast when we stayed at the bokahotel (englishbreakfast)but we didnt like it. We dont know if the breakfast at the hotel was bad or if we dont like the englishbreakfast at all. The price for one night is favourable. All by all the hotel is joinable. You book it if you only want your hotel to sleep there. But if you want to spend time in the hotel i would recommend you another hotel . SN,TS,JH

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value. Not the ritz but at the price, fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: SimonBrooks077
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for more. A clean, nice little hotel. As the title says, it's not the Ritz, it's fairly basic and in the middle of some remodelling. (At least I assume it is from the work going on during the day - saw, not heard - so no problem). The room was a fair size, double bed and a single and surprisingly enough a kitchen. That was a good surprise. Very comfortable although the room could have used a chair instead of a second bed. Breakfast was 3 slices of toast, bacon, sausage, egg and beans, with cereal available if you wanted it. Cooked very nicely. Had a great stay, would definitely stay again and at the price (including breakfast) it was exceptional value. Highly recommended. I'll be coming back later in the year. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “The value for money was perfect”
Reviews.Author: London07-10
Reviews.Content: If you pay Â£ 30 pp in the central of London you can' t bide to sleep in a Hilton Tidy beds, a complete arranged kitchen only the bathroom was a little bit to small and not the best one All rooms had a tv and the walk to the underground lasted two minutes maybe Perfect location for a perfect value

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: janetbicerasantiago
Reviews.Content: Boka hotel is a nice location, affordable rooms,a quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: snowpingu
Reviews.Content: Boka has its fans and critics. Here's my review, I hope you find it helpful. The good: - cheap rates - good location for Earls Court tube but in a quiet street - someone on reception 24 hours (although English may not be their first language!) - breakfast included - fridge in rooms - some rooms are enormous! - variety of rooms available, inc those which take many people - towels provided and changed regularly The neutral: - breakfast is cheap food but ok as a basic start to the day. There is a cooked egg, bacon, beans, sausage and toast. Plus cornflakes. - don't expect a scenic view. The bad: - rooms are basically clean but don't look under or behind the furniture. The furniture had obviously never been moved to clean, there was a thick layer of dust. I also found used boxer shorts under the bed! - similarly with the showers etc - don't look up! - some rooms don't seem to have curtains. I have stayed a couple of times and once, on complaining, I eventually got some curtains after a couple of days. - similarly furniture and facilities are not consistent across rooms. - some walls/floors can be thin: ok as long as your neighbour isn't noisy. - I may have picked up fleas from the hotel. No, you can never confirm this but the doctor said hotels are the usual place and the timing was right. It's hard to answer the question "would you recommend this to a friend?" It depends what you want - a cheap, quiet hotel with basic food, maybe. Any luxury, no.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: EmmaMary213
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 6 days in July of this year, and after arriving straight from a 24 hour flight from Australia went up to our room to find the most disgusting excuse for a hotel room we have ever seen. To begin with, it was absolutely nothing like the few pictures available online. There was dirty underwear from the previous guests on the floor, and the used towels and sheets were still in the room from the previous guests as well. The rubbish had not been taken out, and the bathroom was so filthy it looked like we would contract a communicable disease from going in there. When we went down to complain, the one nice man on the desk called the manager, who couldn't even be bothered coming in to talk to us. We immediately demanded our money back and left.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: mesdupmoi
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be unhelpful, rude and sarcastic, along with my room -aside from the bathroom- being a terrible state. I believe the only reason my bathroom was mostly clean was because it was clearly still new. The toilet still had the manufacturers stickers on! I say mostly clean, because my shower curtain was mouldy, as was the basket in which they put the shampoo. The matress on the floor - how they can call that a bed I do not know - was lumpy, the sheets, while clean and white, were scratchy, and the single curtain (yes 1, not 2!) was hanging by threads while barely covering the window. One of the mugs provided in the kitchenette was mouldy, there were holes in the walls and ceiling, all of the pillows were stained yellow and smelt disgusting. The window (that was previously over the door) was shining on to the bed area, which was highly disturbing, and when people checked in to the hotel at 2am they put them in the room above us - we were previously the only guests in the hotel, so there were more than enough other rooms that wouldnt have disturbed the one lot of guests they did have!! The cushions on the sofa did not match, and the room in all was mismatched and cramped. I appreciate that this is described as a budget hotel, but the rooms push that to the very boundaries, while the prices say otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: lilian047
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three people, the room I was shown was terrible. There was no beds it was just matteress on the floor, you could not stand up in the bedroom and you had to climb a ladder to get to it. There was not room for three people it was big enough for one. The view into the back yard was dreadful. My children were in tears and it spoilt our whole trip to London. I refused to stay there it was the worse place I have ever seen in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Bed and Breakfast, reviews are ridiculous!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotergrl04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Boka last weekend and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. The hotel has been completely redone, and the rooms have kitchenettes and the lift in the new lift is definitely convenient. I don't understand any of these reviews. As for bed bugs I never encountered them, but my understanding is they are no biased to anything or anyone and have been found in even the most expensive hotels. The room was clean and the staff were wonderful. I would gladly stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raggy_doll87
Reviews.Content: Okay so positives first: The hotel is in a great location right next to Earls Court station, which is great. This Iâ€™m afraid is it on the positives. The negatives: BED BUGS!!!!!!!! My self and my partner have both been bitten all over our bodies from the bed bugs and have been to the doctor who has confirmed it is Infact Scabies (which is caught from dirty bedding) I emailed the company to complain and did get back a email with an attachment from the manager stating that we have not got it from them and basically calling us and our doctor a liar! The bedroom its self was a great size but the furnishings in Boka's words are "tired" but thatâ€™s still no excuse for having towels up instead of curtains???? The bathroom that was shared i believe has never seen bleach in its life and was absolutely disgusting!!! So all in all I would say firmly DO NOT GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jemsmith24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the boka on saturday and sunday night. I was absolutly dreading it after reading so many bad reviews! I was so close to cancelling this hotel and was going to book something a little bit more upmarket and lets say a little bit more pricey. I am so glad i didnt bother as all we ever used the hotel for was to sleep in anyway. As i first walked into the hotel my first thoughts were ' I am not staying here' but as we got into are room we were pleasantly surprised. Kitchenette, bathroom and a bedroom with one double bed and one single bed (we booked a quad room for 2 nights but ended up with 2 triple rooms for the same price). Very friendly english guy on reception but other than that i don't think the other staff speak much english. I'm not saying the hotel is perfect-it could do with a lick of paint, but for the price we paid we thought we did well. Earls court tube station literally round the corner and a full English breakfast to start the day off-just lacking juice at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Boka hotel on Wednesday...”
Reviews.Author: Zavier1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boka hotel on Wednesday 1st of September. The place is a complete shambles and I would strong advise anyone never to book a room at this hotel. I was put in room 301 and I am a full trade union official and therefore I am aware of health and safety matters. Room 301 was a healthy and safety concern. The toliet in the room smelled by sewage, sheets on the bed were filthy,the tv did not work, there were ants on my bed,the shower was a complete joke with no shower curtain and the the water just dribbled from the shower head. It was a traumatic experience and worst than "faulty towers" if anyone remembers that sitcom from the 1970s. The breakfast room is at the basement and is filthy. The place should be closed down as it's a health and safety risk. I will be contacting the relevant authorities to investigate this place. The personnel at the hotel are very unprofesional and do not wear a uniform and appear as guests. I spoke to reception and raised my concerns. The manager was not in until 11am and I told them to ensure that the manager called me and left my business card. They were more concerned in me me paying the bill but under the circumstances the room was not fit for purpose and as predicted the manager did not call me so I will see if he has the audacity to try and respond to my complaint like he has done in previous posts by customers. The manager has my number and he can call me but I have no faith and therefore will ensure the local health and safety department to visit this hotel. I urge readers DO NOT stay at this place. It's worse than some of the hotels I have stayed in rural South East Asia and at least they were polite and understanding. I made a bad mistake booking a room at this place and with so many other hotels in Earls Court book else where.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS, SMELLY AND DOWN RIGHT DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: missme39
Reviews.Content: To start with the positives the staff were friendly and the hotel is in a good location. However....the rooms were smelly and unclean...the pillows on the bed were stained yellow and smelt. Friends got bitten by bed bugs all over their bodies which spoilt their holiday to Spain the following day as, as soon as we arrived they had to go to the pharmacy who advised them to stay away from the sun! The shower was open onto the toilet and the bathroom flooded. The water was cool and the shower had no power. Yes this hotel is cheap and yes London is an expensive city! But fork out the extra Â£10 and stay somewhere where you don't feel you might catch something from simply sitting on the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Pick the right room and you'll be pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: gardenandchaos
Reviews.Content: I stay in Boka everytime I visit London in Room 24, on the second floor. It is a private room that is bright, clean, has two beds, kitchenette, lovely bathtub, telephone, tv, and yes, what seems to be the infamous view of the junkyard. When I first arrived at Boka on a last minute reservation several years ago, I was a bit nervous about what to expect. The hotel is a bit stuffy, dark, a bit smelly, and not exactly pretty. I was lucky to get room 24, was pleasantly surprised by how bright, new, and clean it is. I poked my head around other rooms and I probably wouldn't want to stay there- yes maybe I'd agree with the rest of the reviews then. The BEST part about this hotel though is really the location. It's less than a 2 minute walk from the Warwick Road entrance of Earl's Court Station (zone 1), buses, and less than 5 minutes from an M&S Simply Food, Tesco, and of course all the restaurants and conveniences that Earl's Court road has to offer. The thing you have to remember is that London is expensive! So Boka is a great value if you pick the right room. I paid about 44 a night, it's better if you call in to book rather than using online brokers that actually make you pay upwards of 20 more for the room. But it's all about the experience- you'll fall in love with Boka's value and weird english charm. It's definitely perfect to stay in with friends, maybe not for a romantic getaway. (You can spend the extra money saved on a couple pints down the road every night.) The people that work there are kind, gracious, polite, and helpful. The hotel is definitely a story you will be telling people about for a while. Keeping in mind the aforementioned caveats, ultimately I recommend this hotel and room to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ronjandavis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights. The room was clean and the bed comfortable and the staff were very helpful. It was better than we expected as there had been some very negative reviews. If one wants to pick faults, the view into the back yard of the hotel wasn"t the best and the breakfast whilst adequate was pretty ordinary. The hotel is located centrally about three minutes walk from Earl's Court station. We were flying out from Heathrow late in the evening and we left our luggage at the hotel after we checked out. On our return to collect our luggage we were offered the free use of a bathroom and fresh towels so that we could freshen up before our journey home. We thought that this was fairly good service from a very reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: PerthLft
Reviews.Content: We ( my daughterand I ) booked this hotel on the strength of the kitchenette and the few positive reviews- believing that we weren't that fussy! We arrived on a very hot day into a small room on the basement floor - had to negotiate thru the dining room which was smelly and the room was also smelly. Windows did not stay open ( had to prop them up with an empty water bottle) and there was no kitchenette. Looked onto a lumber yard so we weren't sure what would come in if we left the windows open! And as we later discovered the shower did not run hot water. I complained - mostly about the kitchenette and they moved us to another room for the next 3 nights. Which was cleaner, but the kitchenette not worth the name - no microwave and only one pot and hot plate. Shower still a trickle but at least a warm one. Weren't even game to try the breakfast .Came away with bed lice and would never stay there again. The only good thing to say is that the staff were friendly, and location good - but there are plenty in the area and it is worth paying a little more.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: zadool
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive, the staff and owners were very friendly and tried to be helpful. The hotel is very close to Earls Court tube station..but that is where the positves end... Here are the negatives... The hotel is shabby, run down and dirty. Our rooms were tiny and had the view of a rubbish tip. The bathroom mirror was fixed on with sellotape. The shower dribbled water so you were unable to wash properly. The bedding was old, thin pancake like pillows & threadbare blankets, lucky it was a warm night. The mattress was sagging in the middle. The sink tap was dangerously coming away from its fittings. There were missing cups and everything was dirty...there was mould in the fridge. The breakfast room does not have enough seats. The selection of breakfast is limited, beware if you are vegetarian! The staff do not speak English. All in all we would not stay here again unless were heard the Hotel had had a complete overhall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, again!”
Reviews.Author: Ernst_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: I was in Boka about a year ago in 2009, now in 2010 I wanted to try it again! The pro's of the hotel are the ideal location for small price: about 200 m from Earl's Court Underground. Which is already within the city-zone district! It's extremely easy to find, and also with heavy luggage very well to reach. The check-in was amazingly well arranged. We booked it months ahead, and it was perfectly found and reserved. Within seconds we had the forms to fill out and got the key. The first amazing surprise was: we got the same room! I mean: identically the same room (twin bed), with small kitchen and fridge and view at the yard at the back. So excellent for comparison. When we arrived, the London-weather was improving, actually at days it became quite warm. So when entering the room, we noticed immediately that the heating was on, and the window was opened(!). There is no knob to turn the heating off, so we had to ask at the reception to send someone up with tools to turn off the heating. After a while, the girl from the desk was very friendly to do it herself. However, we later noticed she had really turned up the heat! The next morning the heating was immediately shut down completely. And we were able to sleep with closed window. The room was clean, though the light in the shower/bathroom was initially broken, later it was more like a stroboscopic experience, and finally they replaced it and it was fine. The breakfast was identical: nice english breakfast (I still have the impression that the continental is the toast-only version of the english-breakfast) with sausage, beans, and fried egg with bacon. Wonderfull to start off the day! There actually were new chairs, and the service was swift. Boka is excellent money: it is of course not a 5-star hotel, but what it delivers is funny and decent. The funny part is where something is not really working as expected. However the staff was always willing to fix the problem. It's an ideal hotel if you want to explore London by day, and use the rooms to sleep or freshen-up. And? Did it change? Well, the service is definately improved! The rooms were identical, the breakfast-furniture was changed, and they can still have some improvement-ideas for 2010/2011! And yeah: I'll be back in 2011 ;-) Ernst from Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: BabSweden
Reviews.Content: The cheapest hotel I could find close to the tube and it was OK. Nothing fancy at all but gave a good nights sleep. Decent fry-up for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “book elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sigsam1984
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again, I was woken by 5am by constant banging from upstairs which continued until 9am, I spoke to the Receptionist to complain there was also other guests that experienced the same problems around the Hotel the walls and floors are paper thin and you can hear everything through them! I'm not a picky person and I wouldn't normally complain but this was abit much, also the sheets on the beds where stained and I left without having Breakfast as I thought this was the safest option

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly in central London”
Reviews.Author: RudyVSCH
Reviews.Content: Very affordable location near tube & buses, quiet street, very friendly staff, basic accomodation but everything okay for travellers that seek for budget friendly lodging in Central London. No luxury, but bed & shower & breakfast quite okay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Seek-rightly
Reviews.Content: We checked in hoping that it will be at least a decent hotel with decent rooms. We were put into a double bed room. The bed itself is nicely done but it is on a mezzanine that we have to climb a stairs and crawl as it is 3 ft to the ceiling. The room smell mouldy. We went back to receptionist and asked for another room. We were give another double bed room. The bed is nicely done but the curtains on the windows were dirty and the carpet is also dirty. The shower head was there but not installed. We asked for another room but was told that it was the best that they could offer us. Left after one night after being assured by the receptionist that we can go somewhere if we find a better place. But they still charge us with 3 nights because of the cancellation policy per expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value in London”
Reviews.Author: Eur0Trip
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some appalling hotels in London in the past we are always wary when booking an inexpensive room on our visits. We were pleasantly surprised by the Boka, and even asked to extend our stay. The Boka is in a typical London terrace just around the corner from Earls Court tube: a fabulous location using the District line east and west and the Piccadilly line into central areas. Firstly, they are doing some construction and we saw some of the equipment but were never disturbed by any noise. We stayed in a room on the top floor (no lift, so be prepared to carry the luggage up the steep stairs, although it appeared that they may be installing a lift.) To our surprise, our double room with private bathroom turned out to be a large room suitable for 3, with a sofa, tv and own kitchenette with a brand new small cooktop, fridge and sink. There wasn't much in the way of equipment but we managed. There is also an enormous 24 hour Tesco a short walk away. The room appeared to us as partially renovated (brand new kitchenette but needed a paint; new bathroom suite but elderly bed). Everything was clean but we didn't get very much in the way of room service - we had to ask for clean towels after a few days and bed not made etc. Front desk service was much better- when we asked to extend our stay we were going to move to another room but they took it upon themselves to rearrange the bookings so that we didn't have to move. Much appreciated! London is an amazing but expensive city and the Boka was a perfect base for us. It is certainly the best hotel that we have stayed in in this price range (and even better than some more expensive and better TripAdvisor-rated hotels) due to the advantages of space, privacy, kitchenette and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, no unpleasent suprises, supreme location and price”
Reviews.Author: Lars_qwert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Boka hotel for 3 days with my mother and my 2 brothers (Mom being 50y, me 23 and brothers 21 and 18 - Family get together) we just wanted a place to stay close to the center and metro, as we spent all day and evening in the city. And it did just that, and despite what other reviews says, the English breakfast was very nice, the rooms where bright and clean, soap, shampoo, towels was in place, and beds was mediocre but definitely served the purpose. We never really needed to get in contact with any personnel, but cleaning of the rooms was done nicely, and the handing back and fourth of the key happened with a smile. Can be recommended. Tip: The hotel is very old, and so it is very loud whenever people walk by in corridors or open/close doors, if you, like me, are not used to creaking sounds, I recommend bringing a set of ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: nina1988
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister booked this hotel for our weekend break to London. We got there and took one look at the rooms and left. We ended up cancelling our reservation because of the very low standards. The Bathroom was grimy, there was what seemed to be a metal scrap yard on view outside of the window, the curtains were hanging off the rails and there was mould on the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Bed & Breakfast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajhemworld
Reviews.Content: Was my 1st time in UK & got a good deal of 25 GBP for room + breakfast, rooms were average not that great, but just for sleeping, common bath & toilets (Shared), good location near earl's court tube. No restaurants etc but good for people on a shoe string budget. I remember the basement has a breakfast room with a television area, also the hotel was kind enough to let me use the kitchen for light cooking/heating etc

Reviews.Title: “Old & basic, but clean, friendly and superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: hncsys
Reviews.Content: I stay here in room 37 Ist floor in April 2009. The staffs' English was not 100% but were very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit of a surprise it was very old probably 80s decor in real need of TLC, but spotlessly clean. The sheets for example were sparkling white. See my photos for a better idea. It had a communal toilet and separate shower at the end of the hall. They were very small probably converted broom cupboards, but again spotlessly clean (you will need to bring your own shower gel etc) The walls as previously mentioned are pretty thin. It was very warm overnight, a bit difficult to get to sleep. In the morning breakfast was in the basement again a bit dated decor but spotless breakfast ws lovely and the staff were great!. Now for my biggest surprise when I checked out I was charged Â£25 yes Â£25! for a hotel right beside Earls Court - Fantastic. I noted a lot of renovation work ongoing and I would say it will get better. A lot of areas had just been painted so a work in progress. This suited me perfectly for an overnighter - Would suit single folk/Students. Please note this was a single rooms and this review does not cover double or family rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Bokamazing for that price”
Reviews.Author: maxweel
Reviews.Content: I had the room 304 (top floor with a view on the street). Although I booked for a double room with a shared bathroom we got a double with our own bathroom (all very clean, with soap and shampoo as in any hotel, but with low water pressure in the shower...but we had warm water, it's the most important) and a full kitchenette with fridge, hotplates (but we hadn't brought a pan...) and dishes. As my girlfriend and I are quite tall the bed was just long enough to contain our feet but we slept quite well. Yes, the breakfast is greasy if you choose the "English" one, try the coninental if you want. But still it is quite as greasy as any pub's Fish'n Chips. And the staff was really cool as they always made us our breakfast although we were late twice. Without any doubts, 3 days for 114Â£ in those conditions is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Book it,don't listen to the negative opinions!”
Reviews.Author: one-romanian_artist
Reviews.Content: Hi to everybody;just want to say that Boka is a good clean decent newly refurbished hotel with a friendly nice staff as well. The rooms are larger than i have seen in another London hotels which are more expensive than Boka;and they have a kitchen as well! Not only a corner which is kitchen ! For me the bad opinions about this hotel are a mistery;they are unfair and not objective. And i must say the rooms are not ugly as some people say;of course it doesn't pretend to win an interior design prize but they look quite ok! If you want a boutique hotel this is not the one but it doesn't pretend to be;anyway looks better than many other hotels from london.And the prices as well,i had a single ensuite in a double room for just 35 GBP in april 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Almost get what you paid for...”
Reviews.Author: mlaffer
Reviews.Content: For the rate of about 55 pounds a night for a private bath we were not expecting much. However, the toilet barely worked, forcing us to use the one downstairs. The floor was dirty and there were some disgusting stains on the sheets. It was not possible to adjust the heat in the rooms and the front desk would not change it. You can hear other people talking and watching television through the walls of the room. However, if you are willing to put up with horrible conditions to save alot of money, the location is great ,close to the tube in a safe area and the breakfast included is suprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: karen80
Reviews.Content: We werenÂ´t expecting much for the price but nothing could have prepared us for what met our eyes. To begin with the manager wanted us to pay in cash even though it said clearly online that they accepted creditcards! We had to ask for towels and our TV was broken. Our room was on the ground floor next to the reception so we could here people coming and going all night thanks to the ultra sqeaking floor in front of our room. The shower was thiny and horrible. It had no ventilation and the showercutrain was filthy and slimy!!! The "english breakfast" was disgusting and repulsive. We will always remember this hotel for how bad it was. AVOID - AVOID - AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy - unhelpful - depressing place”
Reviews.Author: jojoooshka
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay here! It is filthy. We watched a very sick mouse die in out mould infested dirty shower (that was in the corner of our room - not separate!!). I told reception and they gave me a towel to pick it up in!!! The restaurant is filthy too. We were offered breakfast as part of the package, but I would not touch anything these people had to offer. If you are looking for a simple room that is clean (like we were!), DO NOT STAY HERE. Truly repulsive place with equally repulsive management. The rooms are damp, dirty, depressing and this accommodation ruined the London experience for us. I avoided going back there each day...

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Dukla
Reviews.Content: We had a horrific but hilarious night at the Boka. My suspicions about the quality of this hotel were raised when we (there were 3 of us) had to step over the various people sitting on the reception floor drinking whisky & eating lychees. I think they were 'staff' but could have lived there. Our room alledgedly had en-suite seperated from the bedroom by a badly fitting curtain. Our friend did not go for the luxury en-suite option and shared his bathroom with a man who kept locking himself out of his room. The ceiling of the communal toilet was made interesting by the fact it now resided on the floor, toilet seat and cistern. To get some air into our smelly disgusting hole of a room I opened the window (some of which came off in my hand) to be greeted with a flat roof below the window strewn with teabags, condoms and other unmentionables. In summary, I have worked in far nicer homeless hostels. Please don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Boka Hotel was a good place to stay for 4 nigths”
Reviews.Author: SarahSwansea
Reviews.Content: I cant understand why people are criticising Boka Hotel. The cost of staying at the hotel per night was reasonable, considering the locality of the hotel. I was impressed with the room. The bedroom was clean and the friendliness of the staff was excellent. Ive stayed at Boka Hotel 3 times and have never been disappointed. The Boka Hotel's website clearly states that it is a cheap, inexpensive hotel for the budget conscious consumers and I didnt expect the hotel to be outstanding. If customers are unsatisfied with Boka Hotel then stay elsewhere and pay extortionate prices for a room. Furthermore, I will definetly be staying at Boka Hotel again when im at London.

Reviews.Title: “Survived it - just!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay here - - well just don't! If you are forced to stay here, then be sure to take your bug spray, some bedding to replace the worn out and shredded stuff supplied, a shelf of Dictionaries to assist translation into a variety of foreign languages to communicate with the other guests, and finally some more bug spray. They are BiG! As a flopshop it may just be justifiable for the impoverished backpacker passing through London in one night, though other nearby hotels seemed to offer much better accomodation at very much cheaper on the day prices than I paid. (All part of the risk of using an agency online to book through I suppose.) As a hotel for anyone contemplating having a stress free place to relax in after business or sightseeing, forget it, it fails on every count. It is the lowest level of accomodation possible and does not care a bit!

HotelInfo.Name: Boka Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 33-35 Eardley Crescent, London SW5 9JT, England
